definition: suffix of a noun of locality

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)

sentences.english: Yes, go right out those doors and you'll see the exchange window straight ahead.
sentences.chinese: 可以，直接從那邊門走出去，正前方有個兌換處。

sentences.english: A small side door led into the whitewashed corridor from which the three bedrooms opened.
sentences.chinese: 一扇邊門通到三個房間開向的刷了石灰的走廊。

sentences.english: Two stunted apple trees raised their gnarled and knotty branches on either side of the wicket gate.
sentences.chinese: 邊門兩旁，是兩株瘦小的蘋果樹那多節的椏枝。

sentences.english: She walked over to the door she had seen Stela go through.
sentences.chinese: 她朝斯特拉剛纔經過的那扇邊門走去。

sentences.english: A side gate led into the churchyard.
sentences.chinese: 一道邊門通往教堂墓地。

sentences.english: They emerged through a side door and walked around the building to the front.
sentences.chinese: 他們從一個邊門出去，繞着大樓走到了前面。

sentences.english: To continue printing, close printing door.
sentences.chinese: 要繼續印相，關閉印相機的邊門。

sentences.english: They slid through the wicket in the big gate.
sentences.chinese: 他們滑行通過大門口的邊門。

sentences.english: The children stampede out through those side doors.
sentences.chinese: 孩子們從各個邊門蜂擁而出。

sentences.english: Let's board the side door up.
sentences.chinese: 讓我們用板把邊門釘上。
